title: How did Nestorian Christianity arrive in China? - Quora

response.answer_text: 示存异方之教/ Show the existence of foreign religions -The Emperor Taizong of Tang Dynasty A Syrian priest named 阿罗本 (sorry I have no idea of his English/Syrian name) came to China to meet with the Emperor. The Emperor made the statement on the top and then greeted him and allowed him to preach. Nestorianism was named 景教 and was categorized as one of the three barbarian religions/三夷教 in China. The other two are Zoroastrianism and Monism.  Okay, I have to correct my answer after a web search. The first arrival was earlier than that. The Prince of the Sassanid Empire 卑路斯二世 and his sisters, some other Iranian nobles escaped to Tang Dynasty and granted title by the Emperor after Sassanid was defeated by Arabs. Many of they got married with the Emperor and nobles here and granted high positions in the palace. So they may have already carried Nestorianism to China.
